title: Why I won't be watching the King's Coronation
description: While millions tune into the coronation, some people will make a conscious effort not to watch.

title: Coronation: Think of millions working during celebrations - union
description: Coronation celebrations will depend on millions working through the weekend, say trade unions.

title: Online banking fears prompt call for more hubs
description: Age UK says a programme of shared hubs should be accelerated to help those who want face-to-face banking.

title: Arsenal 3-1 Chelsea: Angry Gunners show they are still in title race
description: Arsenal are back on top of the Premier League table but the odds remain against them winning the Premier League title, writes Phil McNulty.

title: Rory McIlroy says RBC Heritage withdrawal was for his 'mental and emotional wellbeing'
description: Rory McIlroy says his "mental and emotional wellbeing" was a reason for him withdrawing from the RBC Heritage event last month.

title: Man, 24, charged with murder over Bodmin stabbing
description: Jake Hill is charged with murder, attempted murder and causing grievous bodily harm, police say.

title: Wednesday's gossip: Messi, Martinez, Nagelsmann, Pochettino, Rice, Guehi, Mane
description: Lionel Messi will leave Paris St-Germain at the end of the season, Tottenham's pursuit of Julian Nagelsmann stalls, Mikel Arteta is given £200m backing, plus more.

title: Colin Marr death: Forensic and pathology review ordered
description: Colin Marr died from a single blow from a kitchen knife in 2007 after a row with his fiancée Candice Bonar.

title: S4C: Investigation into channel after bullying allegations
description: Claims of "bullying and a toxic culture" were made by a union representing staff.

title: Arsenal 3-1 Chelsea: Martin Odegaard double helps Arsenal back to top of Premier League
description: Martin Odegaard scores twice as Arsenal beat a sorry Chelsea at Emirates Stadium to return to the top of the Premier League.

title: US bank shares slide after First Republic rescue
description: Shares in several regional banks have dropped sharply, a day after the collapse of First Republic.

title: Wrexham: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney join victory parade
description: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney celebrated with thousands of Wrexham supporters in the city centre.

title: Man arrested outside Buckingham Palace
description: A controlled explosion was carried out after a man threw suspected shotgun cartridges into palace grounds.

title: Wrexham: Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney take photos on bus
description: It has been a night of celebration in Wrexham as the city's football sides celebrate promotions.

title: Lionel Messi suspended by Paris St-Germain for two weeks over Saudi Arabia trip
description: Argentina captain Lionel Messi is suspended for two weeks by Paris St-Germain for missing training to travel to Saudi Arabia without the club's permission.

title: Barcelona 1-0 Osasuna: Substitute Jordi Alba hits late winner
description: Leaders Barcelona require five points from their last five games to wrap up the La Liga title after Jordi Alba's late winner against 10-man Osasuna.

title: Jimmy Fallon and Stephen Colbert shows affected by US TV writers' strike
description: Late-night shows are first affected, but history proves the impact of the strike may be bigger.

title: Coronation: No drama over swearing allegiance, says archbishop
description: For the first time at a coronation, the public are being invited to swear allegiance to the monarch.

title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool boss charged by FA over comments about referee Paul Tierney
description: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp is charged by the FA for his comments about referee Paul Tierney after his side's 4-3 win against Tottenham on Sunday.

title: Sue Gray chose not to engage with Labour job inquiry, minister says
description: The Cabinet Office updates MPs on the circumstances around her talks about a senior Labour role.

title: Tinder swipes left on Russia a year after invasion
description: The owner of the dating app follows other global brands that cut ties in 2022.

title: Fran Kirby: Chelsea and England midfielder confirms she will miss World Cup
description: Chelsea and England midfielder Fran Kirby confirms she will miss the World Cup because of a knee problem which requires surgery.

title: Austin Killips: Transgender cyclist wins UCI event
description: Austin Killips becomes the first transgender athlete to win a UCI women's stage race at the Tour of the Gila in New Mexico.

title: Loneliness as dangerous as smoking, says US surgeon general
description: A new advisory is calling for social isolation to be treated as a health issue as serious as obesity.

title: Afghanistan: 'Nothing we can do but watch babies die'
description: The grim hospital where even basic needs cannot be met and children die of preventable diseases.

title: Khader Adnan: Rockets fired after Palestinian hunger striker dies in Israeli jail
description: Rockets are launched into Israel after a prominent Palestinian prisoner dies in an Israeli jail.

title: Dog diplomacy: Turkey sends Mexico puppy after search dog's death
description: The puppy is meant to "carry on the legacy" of a Mexican search dog that died after Turkey's quake.

title: Lucy Letby says she 'only wanted to care for babies'
description: The nurse, accused of murdering seven babies, tells jurors she has never tried to harm or kill children.

title: Sudan crisis: Civilians facing catastrophe as 100,000 flee fighting - UN
description: A further 334,000 people have been displaced within Sudan, but hopes rise of possible peace talks.

title: Bumper BP profits of £4bn in three months spark criticism
description: Strong profits lead to renewed calls for energy firms to pay more tax, with households facing high bills.

title: Labour set to ditch pledge for free university tuition, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer said his party was "likely to move on" from its previous policy of scrapping fees.

title: NHS pay deal signed off for one million staff
description: Ministers agree to pay a 5% rise in England - but nurses are still threatening strike action.

title: Family says murdered Marelle Sturrock was expecting baby boy
description: Marelle Sturrock was 29 weeks pregnant when she was found dead at her home last week.

title: Met Gala 2023: Doja Cat and Jared Leto deliver Lagerfeld-inspired looks
description: Doja Cat was among the stars paying tribute not just to Karl Lagerfeld - but also his famous feline.

title: UK's Sudan evacuations nearly over, says Cleverly
description: James Cleverly says UK airlifts from Sudan are over, as focus shifts to providing humanitarian aid.

title: Leeds set to sack manager Javi Gracia and in talks with Sam Allardyce
description: Leeds United are set to sack manager Javi Gracia and are in talks to appoint former England boss Sam Allardyce.

title: Women's World Cup blackout in Europe: Fifa boss Infantino wants more money for rights
description: Fifa president Gianni Infantino says it would be "a pity" if they had to impose a broadcast blackout in Europe's top five football nations for this year's Women's World Cup.

title: Some supermarket food prices 'should fall' soon
description: Cost savings for milk and other dairy goods should be passed on, the industry body says.

title: 'Prison jobs aren't like you see on TV and films'
description: The number of under-30s working in English and Welsh prisons has gone up by about 60% in five years.

title: Watch: Hiding bear leaps from bin at US school
description: Principal James Marsh gets a surprise at Zela Elementary School in West Virginia.

title: UK house prices in surprise rise in April, says Nationwide
description: Market conditions improving after prices fall for seven consecutive months, Nationwide says.

title: Minnesota senator appears topless while casting vote over Zoom
description: Republican lawmaker Calvin Bahr casts a vote at a legislative meeting streamed live on YouTube.

title: Kenya starvation cult: 'My wife and six children followed Pastor Mackenzie'
description: Kenyans are trying to fathom why more than 100 people may have starved to death in an isolated camp.

title: 'Eight fox cubs are having a party in my garden'
description: Liz Renshaw captured the family having fun on the trampoline in her back garden.

title: Eurovision: 'I hosted the show minutes after a bomb scare'
description: With the contest just days away, its 1993 presenter recalls the drama of the show she hosted in Ireland.

title: Over the sea to Skye on the world’s last turntable ferry
description: The clever design of the MV Glenachulish ferry makes it ideal for navigating challenging tidal conditions.
